oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Account of Gold Star Widows and Mothers Pilgrimage by Sarah Frances M. Ring
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The Ring family of Franklin, Tenn., provided three of their four sons to the Army in WWI. The third oldest, Pvt. Frank M. Ring, Co. A, 114th MG Battn., 30th Div., was killed in Oct., 1918. In the early 1930s the US government offered trips to Gold Star Mothers and Widows to visit the graves of their kin. Sarah Frances Ring and her daugther, Emma Rai Ring, made the trip in 1933. In this account, Mrs. Ring makes simple notations about their travels and activities each day.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
